title: [$125] Remove TestDrive from sign-up flow

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
We currently have what's called a TestDrive that shows in various onboarding flows, right after the requisite, required information is provided (it differs on the onboarding intent. It looks like this. We'd like to remove this modal because: - We have a permanent training modal on Home, for new and existing users - This modal was always awkward, in that we close the required modal and then show this modal, which creates extra friction - We're making lots of changes to onboarding that focus more in immediate interaction with Concierge AI Product details for this issue: - Remove the "test drive" modal - Land the user on the relevant page, based on the onboarding intent. For most users this is going to be the Home page, but for some intents, we send them to the workspace editor directly at the moment. - We're not getting traction on the boss email input. Any other questions, let us know!
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @brunovjk
EXFY-18126

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.26-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/82257 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** jsdoijsoidnjoisjdsoi@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Mac 26.2 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Distance rates are enabled. - Workspace has two distance rates. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create a manual distance expense. 4. Open the expense. 5. Click More > Split > Save. 6. Open any split. 7. Click Report > Create report. 8. On the current report, click Submit and Approve. 9. Go to workspace settings > Distance rates. 10. Delete the distance rate used in Step 3. 11. Open the expense report containing split in the new report (from Step 7). 12. Click Amount. 13. Click on the highlighted row. 14. Click Rate > select other rate > Save. 15. Click Save. ## Expected Result: User should be able to save the split because user has changed the split rate to valid rate in Step 14. ## Actual Result: "Please fix the distance rate error" shows up, but user cannot edit the approved split (from 8). ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/73bb771e-86db-44fe-8e33-3592b1f0ad15 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from here https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05S5EV2JTX/p1772035056144559 We are not currently doing anything if a booking has been canceled, so the user doesn't have the most up to date information shown. Problem: When clients cancel a booking, if they check their booking status in Expensify, then the status will be wrong and they will get confused. Solution: Start displaying the cancelled status

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.26-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176687/test-cases/41236700 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** MacBook Air 15.7.4 Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Preconditions: User A added User B as a copilot with limited access 1. As User A, create a workspace with submission frequency set to manual, enabled approvals and payments 2. As User A, add an expense in the workspace chat 3. Sign in as User B, switch to the User A's account 4. As User B, open expense details from step 2, click Submit 5. As User B, open More menu, click Retract 6. Observe the system message ## Expected Result: Limited copilot is not able to retract expense. When the copilot account retracts the expense, main account's avatar does not appear briefly above the "retracted" system message ## Actual Result: Limited copilot as able to retract the expense. When the full or limited copilot submits the expense, then retracts it, the system message appears with the main account avatar briefly ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1b120274-e250-4718-b8ed-58e672e8aa69 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.26.0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/82257 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2250@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 (Hybrid app) **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Open any workspace chat. 3. Create a map distance expense. 4. Open the report of the just created expense. 5. Tap on "More" > "Split" 6. Long tap and select one of the splits. 7. Tap on dropdown menu and delete it. 8. Note that when landing on report with remaining split, map is not visible and app keeps loading. 9. Return to chat. 10. Note that after app finishes loading, deleted split appears briefly and an "Unexpected error" message appears on remaining split. 11. Reopen report and dismiss the error. 12. Note that you land on chat and both splits disappeared. 13. Return to "Inbox" and reopen chat. 14. Note that remaining split reappears but map is not visible on preview. ## Expected Result: After splitting a distance expense and deleting one split, user should land on report again, where remaining split information and map should be displayed correctly. ## Actual Result: After splitting a distance expense and deleting one split, user lands on report of remaining expense, where app keeps loading and map is not visible. After returning to chat, when app finishes loading, deleted split reappears briefly and an "Unexpected error" message appears on remaining split. Dismissing error message makes remaining split disappears and user has to navigate to "Inbox" and reopen chat to make it reappear. Report preview is displayed without map after split reappears. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/91b2e233-852a-4c30-b27c-354999b0cd1e [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] iOS app crashes with EXC_BREAKPOINT in YAPLPermissionManager.hasContactPermissions

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1772026836510929) ### Background: Following the[ Sentry error](https://expensify.sentry.io/issues/7099206984/?environment=staging&environment=production&project=4510228107427840&query=is%3Aunresolved%20level%3A%EF%80%8DContains%EF%80%8Dfatal&referrer=issue-stream&sort=freq), a fatal EXC_BREAKPOINT crash occurring in the OD native Swift code on iOS. ### Problem The iOS HybridApp crashes with a fatal EXC_BREAKPOINT when the user interacts with contact-related features in the OD . The crash occurs in YAPLPermissionManager.hasContactPermissions [https://github.com/Expensify/Mobile-Expensify/blob/0dbc7e13299f65eaf911b6df5ea864f[…]/iOS/Expensify/Libraries/YAPL-Cocoa/YaplPermissionManager.swift](https://github.com/Expensify/Mobile-Expensify/blob/0dbc7e13299f65eaf911b6df5ea864f02fb4eb1f/iOS/Expensify/Libraries/YAPL-Cocoa/YaplPermissionManager.swift#L38) ### Root Cause Apple introduced a new CNAuthorizationStatus.limited case (rawValue 4) in iOS 18 as part of the "Limited Access to Contacts" feature ([Apple Documentation](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/Contacts/CNAuthorizationStatus/limited)). This allows users to grant an app access to only a subset of their contacts rather than all-or-nothing. The current switch statement in hasContactPermissions only handles .denied, .restricted, .authorized, and .notDetermined. When a user grants limited contact access on iOS 18+, the new .limited status falls into the @unknown default branch, which calls fatalError(), crashing the app immediately. ### Solution Handle .limited as an explicit case alongside .authorized ``` case .authorized, .limited: // ✅ Treat limited as authorized callback(true) ```
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit
  • Upwork Job URL: https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~022026800011963433982
  • Upwork Job ID: 2026800011963433982
  • Last Price Increase: 2026-02-25

Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create a map distance expense. 4. Open the expense. 5. Click More > Split > Save. 6. Open any split. 7. Go offline. 8. Click Amount. 9. Click on the highlighted row. 10. Click Distance. 11. Add one more stop with any waypoint from the recent destination list. 12. Click Save > Save. 13. Go online. 14. Click Distance field. ## Expected Result: Distance field will show the new distance. ## Actual Result: Distance field shows the old distance, but waypoints are updated. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/57a791c7-bcd9-4c28-a062-f8265b34b76f [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Distance - System message shows "changed the expense" after editing distance split

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.26-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/82257 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdjoisnjdosnjdosjoi@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Mac 26.2 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create a map distance expense. 4. Open the expense. 5. Click More > Split > Save. 6. Open any split. 7. Click Amount. 8. Click on the highlighted row. 9. Click Distance > edit waypoints > Save > Save. 10. Open the edited split. ## Expected Result: System message will show "changed the distance to y mi @ RM0.725 / mi (previously x mi @ RM0.725 / mi), which updated the amount to q (previously p)". ## Actual Result: System message shows "changed the expense". ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ca8cf551-9512-4c2f-b458-5c93731e7186 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
